question: Some moderate educationalists in Pakistan and elsewhere are preaching thatPakistan should embrace and implement Islam as understood and interpreted by some Muslim reformers and scholars.
answer:
QUESTION
I wish to ask you a very crucial and sensetative question. Some moderate educationalists in Pakistan and elsewhere are preaching that Pakistan should embrace and implement Islam as understood and interpreted by some Muslim reformers and scholars like Sir Syed Ahmad Khan, Justice Syed Ameer Ali, Moulanas Altaf Hussain Hali, Shibli naumani, Abu Kalam Azad, Obaidullah Sindhi, Syed Jamaluddin Afghani, Mustafa Kamal Pasha etc., etc. Those not following these personalities, according to these educationalists, by implication, means are fundamentalist clerics, orthodox, conservative and so and so for. Kindly enlighten us with your kind views on the above statement. Jazakullah,
ANSWER

When Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) performed Hajj, on the ninth%0D%0Aof Dhul-Hijjah in the plains of Arafaat, being the most auspicious place, on%0D%0Aa Friday, being the most auspicious day of the week, after Asr being the%0D%0Amost auspicious time on a Friday by Jabal Rahmat, the most auspicious place%0D%0Ain the plains of Arafaat, Allah Ta'ala sent Jibraaeel (Alayhis salaam) with%0D%0Athe following verse:%0D%0AToday have I perfected your religion for you, completed my favour upon you%0D%0Aand I am pleased with Islam as your religion.%0D%0A%0D%0AThe verse is clear that Islam is a perfect and absolute religion.%0D%0AConsiderations of reformation is an insult to the perfect religion of Islam.%0D%0ARasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) advised that after his demise, we%0D%0Ashould hold firm to the Qur'aan and his Ahaadith. We should not be concerned%0D%0Aabout people's comments on being orthodox, fundamentalist, etc. Surely, we%0D%0Aare only obliged to please Allah Ta'ala.%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMufti Ebrahim Desai%0D%0AFATWA DEPT.%0D%0A
